Thanks, I rented the movie and will watch it tonight.

joylyn

Julie W wrote:

> Tia said:
> > > Is there a movie called the power of one? Hmmm, I'll have to go
> see if
> > > blockbuster has it and see it to see if it's appropriate.

> > Definitely watch it first.
>

> beginning of
> it by accident with a babysitter when they were quite young and they found
> the bullying parts at the beginning very disturbing.
>
> As I recall there are big boys urinating on a little boy, parents
> dying and
> a rooster being throttled in the first ten minutes. I thought of
> saving it
> for the teen years although I have seen a child's version of the book on
> sale.
>
> Julie W

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Power of One
messages.msgSnippet: ... of ... and ... it ... It definitely is disturbing in parts, but I think middle school students would probably be fine with it, depending on what grade the
messages.messageBody:
> > Definitely watch it first.
>
> I would just like to second this comment - my children saw the beginning
of
> it by accident with a babysitter when they were quite young and they found
> the bullying parts at the beginning very disturbing.
>
> As I recall there are big boys urinating on a little boy, parents dying
and
> a rooster being throttled in the first ten minutes. I thought of saving
it
> for the teen years although I have seen a child's version of the book on
> sale.

It definitely is disturbing in parts, but I think middle school students
would probably be fine with it, depending on what grade the middle school
starts. Grade 7 for sure, maybe grade 6, but not grade 5. And that's a
generalization. <g> I think Lars was 12 when he saw it.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Power of One
messages.msgSnippet: ... I would just like to second this comment -  my children saw the beginning of it by accident with a babysitter when they were quite young and they found the
messages.messageBody:
Tia said:
> > Is there a movie called the power of one? Hmmm, I'll have to go see if
> > blockbuster has it and see it to see if it's appropriate.
>
> Definitely watch it first.

I would just like to second this comment - my children saw the beginning of
it by accident with a babysitter when they were quite young and they found
the bullying parts at the beginning very disturbing.

As I recall there are big boys urinating on a little boy, parents dying and
a rooster being throttled in the first ten minutes. I thought of saving it
for the teen years although I have seen a child's version of the book on
sale.

Julie W
Wellington
New Zealand
